page.title: 18Eglingham C.E.School.(cont.)
page.content: The school itself has had extensions of cloakrooms and canteen. Storage heaters have replaced black-leaded stoves; vinyl floor covering, carpets and lowered ceilings have been added. Basic mathematics, reading, writing are taught in addition to a wide range of other subjects; computer studies, rural science, technology etc. Climbing frames have been installed to widen the range of physical activities Traditions are also upheld like crafts and maypole-dancing. The children take part in the local community, delivering their harvest gifts to the elderly and sick, baking them short-bread and inviting them to join in school functions and Nativity plays. They visit other schools to see Theatre Companies perform or for sport.
